column5: With the weather turning cold and rainy, we knew that Sunday may be the last outing for at least a little while.  We headed out at around 8pm and fished until 10pm.  We were at our usual night time spot and the carp are now beginning to jump right out of the water.  It's a pretty amazing sight to see these 15 pound plus fish clear the water and wiggle thru the air.  Anyhow, they seem to be hanging out in different areas than last year.  Not long after casting our feeders and hair rigs out there, we began to see line rubs and activity.  We each ended up with one fish.  Bly's was a 17 1/2 pounder....and mine ended up at 19 3/4 pounds.  We decided to show a different side of these big fish....are these faces only a mother could love??? LOL. (I mean the fish......no smart remarks here....)
Great report and pics Cliff and Carole!!!  Dem Carps is damn ugly!!!
nice catch once again cliff and carole!!

Great catch C&C  I think carp are beautiful fish...The Japanese told me so.LOL  If you think about it, some people spend tens of thousands of $ on a single koi for their pond...Carp aren't that different.
I'm gonna have nightmares !!! nice job guys...
good job,congrats to both of you.
I find that all four of you look good. Thanks for sharing.
Even Cliff?  Sorry I had to
Nice fish, hopefully I can catch one this weekend!
As much as I love carping, I gotta admit that those headshots look pretty nasty!
Another good outing and report Cliff and Carole.  I think I like the other side of the fish though,
Feeders? Hair rigs? Line rubs? That's some serious carp fishing lingo there son  . Some pretty huge and disgusting fish you've got there, congrat's!
Watch it mister...you dont weigh that much and the water is pretty cold this time of year....

What I lack in stature, I make up for in speed.  The good lord built me like a Ferrari.  Small, lightweight and agile (Pretty good looking too).  Not only can I get to my baitrunner when a carp takes in record time, my ability to flee from a fight is unrivaled in the animal kingdom...That plus I figure there's at least 15km between either of us at any point in time.  Thank goodness for fiber optics, copper cables and the internet

Yeah well, if we ever fish together then watch it....what I've lost in speed over the years I've gained in patience.....LOL.  I'll just wait until you are fighting a fish....I don't think you'll take off at that point...see?  I already know your weak points....
